usercssData.name: Dark Google Calendar (2020)
usercssData.author: pyxelr
usercssData.description:
“Really appreciate your awesome work. You are making my life so much better than Google's glaring light world.” ~ pht049
Dark theme for Google Calendar that works with the new design. I recommend installing it with Stylus.

GitHub Repository - Feel free to collaborate!
UserCSS - Install the UserCSS style (which supports automatic updates and customization)

Check out my other style - Hacker News - Bluish Gray Hit me up with any hints if something could be improved.

color1.label: Font color of event titles in the month view
color1.name: color1

color2.label: Font color of the past events
color2.name: color2

color3.label: Font color for other kind of events in the month view
color3.name: color3

color4.label: Font color of past events (week view)
color4.name: color4

color5.label: Font color of time and places of events (week view)
color5.name: color5

usercssData.name: Stylus Dark - ShadowFox
usercssData.author: overdodactyl
usercssData.description: This theme is specifically designed to match the dark mode used by Firefox's inspector and browser toolbox (background colors, text colors in the editor, fonts etc.).  Additionally, it is meant to compliment [ShadowFox](https://github.com/overdodactyl/ShadowFox) - a universal dark theme for Firefox.   Hosted on GitHub (please submit any issues there): https://github.com/overdodactyl/Stylus-Dark
